campaign_variables.description: The maximum number of agents that can be assigned to research one technology.
(IN GAME) The advantage an alliance must have over the enemy, to wipe out the opposition on a win in the autoresolver
(IN GAME) The base proportion of losing navy kills that should be converted to captures (may choose to not capture these depending on the random factor applied later)

This is a modifier applied to when calculating whether to take captives or not for a particular unit. Depending on the units base morale this is either added or deducted from the chance to take captives
Base ratio of captives to take in the range 0.0 -> 1.0. This is then modified. Keep to a low number.

This is a modifier that's randomised and then added or subtracted from the base ratio. So If you have a base ratio of 0.1 (10%) and a modifier of 0.75 (75%) you will have a base ratio between 0.025 and 0.175.
(IN GAME) The chance we will not take a ship from the set of possible ships to capture
Base chance ( 0.0 -> 1.0 ) of taking captives. Modified by generals, being out numbered etc...
(IN GAME) The effect an advantage in the generals star rating has on the win chances, effects the overall win chance
(IN GAME) The amount to increase AI casualties in autoresolved battles when campaign difficulty level is easy
(IN GAME) The advantage (applied to combat potential) human units recieve when the battle is austoresolved on battle difficulty easy
(IN GAME) Represents a positive/negative range for Gaussian random numbers - number will never be out of this range
(IN GAME) The standard deviation to be used when calculating Gaussian random numbers
(IN GAME) The amount to decrease AI casulaties in autoresolved battles when campaign difficulty level is hard
(IN GAME) The advantage (applied to combat potential) AI units recieve when the battle is autoresolved on battle difficulty hard
(IN GAME) The casualty percentage improvement/impedance (winner/loser respectively) on a major victory
(IN GAME) The casualty percentage impedance for naval loser on a major loss
(IN GAME) The casualty percentage improvement for naval winner on a major victory
(IN GAME) The percentage of the win chances that should always be calculated by the unit combat potential alone.
(IN GAME) The minimum casualties percentage for a unit on an alliances lose
(IN GAME) The minimum casualties percentage for a unit on an alliances win (altered for class and relative strengths)
(IN GAME) The minimum win chance of an alliance, if their win chance is less than this they cannot win the autoresolve battle.
(IN GAME) The casualty percentage improvement/impedance (loser/winner respectively) on a minor victory
(IN GAME) The casualty percentage impedance for naval loser on a minor loss
(IN GAME) The casualty percentage improvement for naval winner on a minor victory
(IN GAME) The casualty percentage impedance for naval loser on a normal loss
(IN GAME) The casualty percentage improvement for naval winner on a normal victory
The randomness to apply to the amount of captives % of base captives - keep it low
(IN GAME) The percentage of damage to keep on a ship that has been reassigned from sunk to captured
(IN GAME) Randomness of each ships damage, to represent vageries of battle - keep it low
(IN GAME) The percent damage required for a ship unit to sink
(IN GAME) Chance of massacre, compared to a normal win
(IN GAME) Randomness of each units losses, to represent vageries of battle - keep it low
(IN GAME) The amount the damage probability should be scaled by the win chance in a naval battle with an unlikely result
(IN GAME) The amount to decrease AI casulaties in autoresolved battles when campaign difficulty level is very hard
(IN GAME) The advantage (applied to combat potential) AI units recieve when the battle is austoresolved on battle difficulty very hard
(IN GAME) Number of commodity units always available on the global market for each commodity (to prevent division by zero).
(IN GAME) The base amount of TW required for a town to grow its wealth level. Formula: base_wealth_increase*power((total_wealth_increases+1),2)
(IN GAME). Pop growth percentage in every region regardless of farms. We might want to define this on a per-region basis?
(IN GAME). Integer only.The multiplier applied to a regions prestige if that region is a region the capturing faction must capture to fulfill its victory conditions
(IN GAME). Base recruitment cost for characters
(IN GAME). Cost each command star adds to the cost of the character.
(IN GAME). Max distance for character recruitment (recruitment over this distance will result in a capped distance-cost modifier)
(IN GAME). The maximum size of the character recruitment pool
(IN GAME). Number of turns it takes to add a new admiral to the character recruitment pool.
(IN GAME). Number of turns it takes to add a new admiral to the character recruitment pool. Activated by bonus value.
(IN GAME). Number of turns it takes to add a new admiral to the character recruitment pool. Activated by bonus value.
(IN GAME). Number of turns it takes to add a new general to the character recruitment pool.
(IN GAME). Number of turns it takes to add a new admiral to the character recruitment pool. Activated by bonus value.
(IN GAME). Number of turns it takes to add a new admiral to the character recruitment pool. Activated by bonus value.
(IN GAME) Research points being contributed by character attributes are clamped to this value in any research slot
(IN GAME) Background gdp value.
(IN GAME). Background gdp value for minor nations.

(IN GAME). Integer only. This maps the faction leaders management attribute to a value ( such as +1 / -1 etc... ). This is applied to the ministers management level for working out the minister effects.

(IN GAME). Integer only. This maps the faction leaders management attribute to a value ( such as +1 / -1 etc... ). This is applied to the ministers management level for working out the minister effects.

(IN GAME). Integer only. This maps the faction leaders management attribute to a value ( such as +1 / -1 etc... ). This is applied to the ministers management level for working out the minister effects.

(IN GAME). Integer only. This maps the faction leaders management attribute to a value ( such as +1 / -1 etc... ). This is applied to the ministers management level for working out the minister effects.

(IN GAME). Integer only. This maps the faction leaders management attribute to a value ( such as +1 / -1 etc... ). This is applied to the ministers management level for working out the minister effects.

(IN GAME). Integer only. This maps the faction leaders management attribute to a value ( such as +1 / -1 etc... ). This is applied to the ministers management level for working out the minister effects.

(IN GAME). Integer only. This maps the faction leaders management attribute to a value ( such as +1 / -1 etc... ). This is applied to the ministers management level for working out the minister effects.

(IN GAME). Integer only. This maps the faction leaders management attribute to a value ( such as +1 / -1 etc... ). This is applied to the ministers management level for working out the minister effects.

(IN GAME). Integer only. This maps the faction leaders management attribute to a value ( such as +1 / -1 etc... ). This is applied to the ministers management level for working out the minister effects.

(IN GAME). Integer only. This maps the faction leaders management attribute to a value ( such as +1 / -1 etc... ). This is applied to the ministers management level for working out the minister effects.
This is multiplied to the value for the faction_leader_management_level for an absolute monarchy government type.
This is multiplied to the value for the faction_leader_management_level for a constitutional monarchy government type.
This is multiplied to the value for the faction_leader_management_level for a republic government type.
(IN GAME). The base general/admiral action point bonus
(IN GAME). Gentleman happiness effect in settlement is derived from attribute_level divided by this value (rounded up)
(IN GAME) Total negative effect from all non-allied gentlemen in a settlement is clamped to this.
(IN GAME) Total positive effect from all allied gentlemen in a settlement is clamped to this.
Happiness effect of revolution in a neighbouring faction (per faction).
Happiness effect of revolution of any faction in the same culture (per faction).
Upper (positive) happiness cap for war-related effects.
Lower (negative) unhappiness cap for war-related effects.
Per-turn drift towards 0 of war-related happiness effects.
Happiness effect of a major defeat.
Happiness effect of a major victory.
Happiness effect of taking a region from the enemy.
(IN GAME). As percentage of population
(IN GAME). The minimum pct of the losing units max soldiers a unit can have before it is destroyed
(IN GAME). Maximum percentage of a unit that is lost to attrition every turn
Levels of town wealth that exist in the game data.
0.0005 (IN GAME). Means X% of the minority will emigate
0.012 (IN GAME). Percentage of net unhappiness contributing to unhappiness related migration. NUP% * X% * pop = emigration.
Minimum popluation for a region.
(IN GAME) Mimimum population that must be left after recruitment; so population must be at least this PLUS the recruitment population cost to enable recruitment.
(IN GAME). Passive spying calculation region bonus
(IN GAME). Maximum effect of happiness due to automated policing.
(IN GAME). Policing_pips (sum of both classes) * sqrt(population) * policing_automated_cost_per_pop
(IN GAME). Cap on happiness from garrisoned units.
(IN GAME). The percentage of population growth required to spawn a new town, relative to the population of the last spawning.
(IN GAME) Number by which population is reduced for recruitment of a single unit
(IN GAME). The action point cost to travel 1 unit distance on level zero (unupgraded) roads.
(IN GAME). The action point cost to travel 1 unit distance on level one roads.
(IN GAME). The action point cost to travel 1 unit distance on level two roads.
(IN GAME). The action point cost to travel 1 unit distance on level three roads.
(IN GAME). Base amount loot the looting force get when looting a settlement
(IN GAME). The pct of region town wealth given to a player when looting a settlement (0.0 - 1.0). Player also gets 0.15 of this % of GDP
(IN GAME). Percentage of region town wealth wiped out after looting. 0.0-1.0. (e.g. 0.7 means region town wealth reduced by 70%.)
(IN GAME). Public order penalty when a settlement is looted.
(UNUSED). Number of turns the GDP reduction effect lasts for after looting a region
(IN GAME). Public order penalty when a settlement is looted after it has surrendered.
(IN GAME) State gift diplomatic effect = (gift_value * state_gift_multiplier_linear) + (gift_value * gift_value * state_gift_multiplier_quadratic / root(combined_gdp))
(IN GAME) State gift diplomatic effect = (gift_value * state_gift_multiplier_linear) + (gift_value * gift_value * state_gift_multiplier_quadratic / root(combined_gdp))
(IN GAME) The logarithm base for the formula used for calculating loss of tax income from having too many regions.
(IN GAME) A multiplier on the loss of tax income from having too many regions.
(DEPRECATED) The percentage reduction in tax for each region in a governorship beyond the tax_efficiency_regions_minimum.
(IN GAME) The minimum number of regions before tax efficiency penalties apply.
(IN GAME) The maximum number of regions for tax efficiency purposes.
(IN GAME). Integer only. The multipler applied to a technology's prestige if the discovering in faction is the first faction in its culture to discover that technology
(IN GAME). The amount town wealth is reduced when strikes, riots, ultimatums, letters of demand or rebellions are active in a region.
(IN GAME) The proportion of commodity value which is added to the region gdp if the commodity is not shipped to the home region.
(IN GAME) Length limit on an international trade route.
(IN GAME) How much land routes are preferred over sea routes (0.5 = sea routes twice as preferred).
(IN GAME) The proportion of the trade route value that gets accumulated each turn, "time factor".
(IN GAME) The proportion of the combined gdps of the two factions which contributes to the value of a trade route.
(UNUSED) Volume of commodities a trade ship can export.
(IN GAME) The proportion of the value of a state gift obtained for a unilateral diplomatic gift of equivalent raw value.
(IN GAME). Integer only. The multipler applied to a unit's prestige if the recruiting in faction is the first faction in its culture to recruit a unit of that unit's class
(IN GAME). The minimum pct of the units max soldiers a unit can have before it is destroyed
